docs.title: Welcome to CCSP Docs for RDPMS
docs.text:
This site provides documentation for RDPMS (Remote Diagnostics and Predictive Maintenance Solutions) for Indian Railways Signalling Systems, covering deployment and usage for various railway-related use cases.

For more details, visit Centre of Innovation for IoT/M2M.

docs.title: Welcome to RDPMS Guide
docs.text: This section provides useful details about the RDPMS project and its messages.

docs.title: About RDPMS
docs.text:
RDPMS stands for "Remote Diagnostics and Predictive Maintenance Solutions."
RDPMS is an application platform designed to monitor, analyze, and optimize the performance of assets in remote locations. 
The platform focuses on providing real-time diagnostics, maintenance alerts, and predictive analytics.
It enhance the reliability and efficiency of equipment, helping to prevent costly downtime and extend asset life.

For more details, please visit the RDPMS Standard Data Format Document.

docs.title: Architecture with CCSP
docs.text: This section provides an overview of the integration and high-level architecture of RDPMS with CCSP (Common Control & Service Platform).

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The architecture of RDPMS is designed to seamlessly integrate with CCSP for efficient monitoring, diagnostics, and predictive maintenance of assets. The platform ensures reliable data communication between various components, enabling real-time insights and control.

docs.title: Key Components of the Architecture
docs.text:
1. Station Gateway:
  2. Acts as the primary communication interface between local assets and the CCSP platform.

  3. Responsible for collecting diagnostic data, performing local processing, and forwarding necessary information to the cloud.

  4. Cloud AE (Application Entity):

  5. Hosts the central application logic for data aggregation, analytics, and decision-making.

  6. Facilitates real-time notifications and predictive analytics.

  7. CCSP Platform:

  8. Provides the middleware for managing data storage, subscriptions, and notifications.
  9. Ensures secure and standardized communication between Station Gateway and Cloud AE.

docs.title: High-Level Data Flow
docs.text:
1. Data Collection:
  2. The Station Gateway collects data from assets and sensors.

  3. Data is formatted into standardized payloads for transmission.

  4. Data Transmission:

  5. Standard MQTT topics are used to publish data from the Station Gateway to CCSP.

  6. CCSP stores the data and triggers notifications as needed.

  7. Cloud Integration:

  8. The Cloud AE subscribes to relevant CCSP topics.
  9. It processes the data for diagnostics, maintenance alerts, and predictive analytics.

docs.title: Benefits of Integration with CCSP
docs.text:
• Standardized Communication: Ensures uniform data exchange using oneM2M-compliant protocols.
  • Real-Time Insights: Enables real-time monitoring and diagnostics of assets.
  • Scalability: Supports the integration of multiple gateways and assets.
  • Predictive Maintenance: Leverages data analytics for proactive maintenance and reduced downtime.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: The Station Gateway is an embedded electronic unit deployed at each station to facilitate data acquisition, processing, and communication with the RDPMS Application Software hosted on the Railway Cloud via the CCSP Layer.

docs.title: Key Functions
docs.text:
• Receives data from sensors and diagnostic ports of station equipment.
  • Converts and transmits data using oneM2M Standard Data Format and MQTT Protocol.
  • Ensures interoperability across different vendor systems through standardized communication.
  • Provides event logging to store up to 5 million events or a minimum of 10 days of data.
  • Supports secure data transmission and remote access capabilities.

docs.title: Communication & Security
docs.text:
• Converts data into oneM2M format before transmitting it to the CCSP Layer.
  • Supports various transmission media, including OFC, Ethernet, wireless networks, and voice channels.
  • Includes 12 configurable serial ports for communication with station equipment.
  • Implements data security measures to prevent unauthorized access.
  • Complies with TEC IoT Security Guidelines and undergoes periodic cybersecurity audits.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before setting up a Station Gateway, certain components must already be in place to ensure seamless integration with the CCSP platform and other railway management systems. The following prerequisites must be met: 

- Cloud AE of vendor has already registered and is up and running.
- RAILWAY_MGMT_AE has already registered and is up and running.
- Railway-cloud-endpoint is pre-shared with OEMs.

docs.title: Configuration File
docs.text:
• This file will be shared with the gateway vendor once the configuration of the station gateway is done at CCSP.
  • For details, refer to Device Configuration Parameters.
  • This configuration file will be mailed to the vendor.
  • It will be loaded by the OEM on their respective gateway.

docs.title: MQTT Packet and MQTT Topics for Station Gateway
MQTT Packet:
docs.text:
• <Client-Id> (as a simple string) → ClientID will be set to the following format:
    • <AE-ID>
  • Sample Connect Packet

docs.title: Publish Topic:
docs.text:
/oneM2M/reg_req/<Gateway-AE-ID>/<CSE-ID>/json
/oneM2M/req/<Gateway-AE-ID>/<CSE-ID>/json

docs.title: Topic to be Subscribed:
docs.text:
/oneM2M/reg_resp/<Gateway-AE-ID>/<CSE-ID>/json
/oneM2M/resp/<Gateway-AE-ID>/<CSE-ID>/json
/oneM2M/req/<CSE-ID>/<Gateway-AE-ID>/json

docs.title: One-Time Resources to be Created by Station Gateway
docs.text:
Resources 
- Station Gateway AE Registration Request
- Station Gateway Connect Container and Subscription
- Station Gateway Information Container and Subscription
- Station Gateway Parameter Container and Subscription
- Station Gateway Image Container and Subscription
- Station Gateway Diagnostics Container and Subscription
- Station Gateway Time Sync Container and Subscription
- Station Gateway Configuration Container and Subscription
- Station Gateway Time Sync Acknowledgement Container and Subscription
- Station Gateway Configuration Acknowledgement Container and Subscription

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text:
Quick Summary

This Station Gateway serves as the critical interface between station-level data sources and the CCSP Layer, ensuring efficient, standardized, and secure data communication within the RDPMS ecosystem.

docs.title: About CCSP (C-DoT's Common Service Platform)
docs.text: C-DOT has developed a state-of-the-art, oneM2M-compliant C-DOT's Common Service Platform (CCSP), which facilitates standards-based IoT solutions deployment across the country.

docs.title: What is CCSP?
docs.text:
CCSP is an indigenously developed IoT platform based on the oneM2M standard, which has been declared the National Standard on IoT/M2M by TEC. It acts as a horizontal common service layer for IoT/M2M, offering a set of Common Service Functions (CSFs) required by various IoT verticals.

Supported IoT Verticals 
Energy  
Transport  
Agriculture  
Surveillance  
Smart buildings  
Smart street lights

docs.title: Supported Common Service Functions
docs.text:
C-DOT's Common Service Platform (CCSP) supports 11 Common Service Functions (CSFs), which provide a standardized foundation for IoT/M2M applications. These include:

  1. Registration
  2. Discovery
  3. Group Management
  4. Security
  5. Subscription and Notification
  6. Semantics
  7. Transaction Management
  8. Device Management
  9. Data Management and Repository
  10. Location Services
  11. Application and Service Layer Management

docs.title: Advanced Features
docs.text: In addition to the core CSFs, CCSP offers a range of advanced features designed to enhance IoT/M2M interoperability and efficiency:

docs.title: Interworking and Connectivity
docs.text:
• 3GPP Interworking for NIDD (Non-IP Data Delivery) for NB-IoT (Narrow Band IoT) Devices
  • Supports 3GPP T8 interface
  • Support for MN (Middle Node) and ASN (Access Service Node)
  • SSP (Service Subscription Provider) Restrictions

docs.title: Data and Device Management
docs.text:
• Flex Container for structured and flexible data storage
  • Field Device Configuration
  • Device Management over LWM2M (Lightweight M2M) Protocol and TR-069
  • Service Subscription Management

docs.title: Intelligent Data Handling
docs.text:
• Semantics-based Data Interpretation
  • Time Series Data Handling
  • Transaction Management
  • Resource Announcement Mechanism

docs.title: Benefits for IoT Application Providers
docs.text:
• Simplifies integration by hiding the complexity of: 
      - Secure communication
  - Device management
  - Data handling
    and ensures smooth interoperability across different IoT verticals through standardized APIs.

docs.title: Quick Summary
docs.text: The C-DOT's Common Service Platform is a robust, standards-based platform designed to empower IoT/M2M applications, which provides seamless and secure IoT/M2M deployments, ensuring scalability, interoperability, and reliability across diverse verticals.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This page provides an overview of the various payload formats used within the RDPMS system. It follows oneM2M standard data formats to ensure interoperability between Station Gateways, IoT devices, sensors, and Application Software. These standards enable seamless communication between application software of different OEMs.

Why oneM2M Standards?

The oneM2M standard ensures a unified framework for IoT/M2M communication, making sure different devices and software solutions from multiple vendors can work together without compatibility issues.

Note: Vendors should acquire a basic understanding of oneM2M standards. Refer to oneM2M Guidelines.

docs.title: Data Flow & Containers in CCSP Layer
Registration Process:
docs.text: An initial copy of information container data is uploaded by a railway admin via an Excel sheet. The application software cross-checks data received from the station gateway against the uploaded data and provides an error message if inconsistencies exist.

docs.title: How Data is Organized
docs.text:
The CCSP Layer (C-DOT Common Service Platform) organizes data using containers. These containers act as storage units where data instances are managed.

Container Data Flow
  • Containers are created by the Station Gateway in the CCSP Layer.
  • Data Instances are sent by the Station Gateway to these containers.
  • Applications & Other Entities subscribe to these containers to receive notifications when new data instances are added.

docs.title: Bidirectional Communication
docs.text:
• The Application Software can also create data instances in certain containers.
  • The Station Gateway subscribes to these containers and receives data instances as notifications.

docs.title: Role of CCSP Layer
docs.text:
Authentication & Data Integrity
  • Ensures that only authenticated devices can send or receive data.
  • Verifies that data follows oneM2M standard formats before forwarding it to RDPMS Application Software.

docs.title: Key Takeaways
docs.text:
• The RDPMS system uses oneM2M-compliant data formats to standardize railway IoT communication.
  • CCSP Layer plays a crucial role in device authentication, data integrity, and subscription-based data flow.
  • Data can flow bidirectionally between Station Gateways and Application Software.
  • CCSP is hosted in the Railway Cloud for enhanced security and interoperability.
  • The adoption of oneM2M standards enhances data security, interoperability, and reliability of RDPMS across multiple vendors and systems.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
The Station Gateway Standard Data Format defines the structure of communication between the Station Gateway, CCSP (Common Communication Service Platform), and cloud applications. Each message follows the oneM2M standard and is transmitted over MQTT or HTTP. The requests and responses for various operations follow a standardized JSON payload structure.

This page provides a detailed breakdown of different message types, including their payloads and responses.

docs.title: AE Registration Request (One-Time)
docs.text:
Request SampleRequest & Response Sample With DataField Descriptions 
Request Details:
Broker URL: mqtts://ccsp.m2m.cdot.in
Topic: /oneM2M/reg_req/<STATION-GW-AE-ID>/<registrarCseId>/json

{
    "op" : 1,
    "to" : "<registrarCseBaseResourceId>",
    "fr" : " <STATION-GW-AE-ID>",
    "rqi" : "<unique-Request-Identifier>",
    "ty" : 2,
    "pc" : {
        "m2m:ae" : {
            "api" : "<app-ID>",
            "rr" : "true",
            "srv" : [ "3" ],
            "acpi" : [ "<ACP-Resource-Id>" ],
            "poa" : [ "mqtts://ccsp.m2m.cdot.in/oneM2M/req/CSE001/<STATION-GW-AE-ID>/json" ]
        } 
    },
    "rvi" : "3"
}

Station Gateway AE Reg Request

{
    "op" : 1,
    "to" : "R0",
    "fr" : "SWGwg21074",
    "rqi" : "<unique-Request-Identifier>",
    "ty" : 2,
    "pc" : {
        "m2m:ae" : {
            "api" : "Ra1.com.cdot.smartCity",
            "rr" : "true",
            "srv" : [ "3" ],
            "acpi" : [ "R23" ],
            "poa" : [ "mqtts://ccsp.m2m.cdot.in/oneM2M/req/CSE001/SWGwg21074/json" ]
        }
    },
    "rvi" : "3"
}

Response

{
    "rsc" : 2001,
    "rqi" : "<unique-Request-Identifier>",
    "pc" : {
        "m2m:ae" : {
            "ty" : 2,
            "ri" : "SWGwg21074",
            "pi" : "R0",
            "ct" : "20240229T152015",
            "lt" : "20240229T152015",
            "rn" : "ae18860",
            "acpi" : [ "R23" ],
            "et" : "20290227T142647",
            "api" : "Ra1.com.cdot.smartCity",
            "aei" : "SWGwg21074",
            "rr" : true,
            "srv" : [ "3" ],
            "poa" : [ "mqtts://ccsp.m2m.cdot.in/oneM2M/req/CSE001/SWGwg21074/json" ]
        }
    },
    "rvi" : "3"
}
Field Description op Operation Code (1 for create request). to Destination Resource ID (Target CSE resource ID). fr Sender (Station Gateway AE ID). rqi Unique Request Identifier to track the request. ty Resource Type (2 for <AE>). pc Primitive Content of the request. rvi OneM2M Release Version Indicator. rsc Response status code (2001: Created).

docs.title: Connect Container (with Time Sync Request) Creation & Subscription
docs.text:
## Creation from station gateway to CCSP
Request SampleRequest & Response Sample With DataField Descriptions 
Request Details:
Broker URL: mqtts://ccsp.m2m.cdot.in
Topic: /oneM2M/req/<STATION-GW-AE-ID>/CSE001/json

{
    "op" : 1,
    "to" : "<STATION-GW-AE-ID>",
    "fr" : "<STATION-GW-AE-ID>",
    "rqi" : "<unique-Request-Identifier>",
    "ty" : 3,
    "pc" : {
        "m2m:cnt" : {
            "lbl": [ "<zone_code>", "<zone_code><division_code>", "<zone_code><division_code><sc>" ],
            "rn": "STN_GW_CONNECT_CNT",
            "acpi" : [ "<ACP-Resource-Id>" ]
        }
    },
    "rvi" : "3"
}

Station Gateway Connect Container Request

{
    "op" : 1,
    "to" : "SWGwg21074",
    "fr" : "SWGwg21074",
    "rqi" : "<unique-Request-Identifier>",
    "ty" : 3,
    "pc" : {
        "m2m:cnt" : {
            "lbl": [ "12Z", "12ZDelhi", "12ZDelhi42" ],
            "rn": "STN_GW_CONNECT_CNT",
            "acpi" : [ "R248241" ]
        }
    },
    "rvi" : "3"
}

Response

{
    "rsc" : 2001,
    "rqi" : "<unique-Request-Identifier>",
    "pc" : {
        "m2m:cnt" : {
            "ty" : 3,
            "ri" : "R51185",
            "pi" : "SWGwg21074",
            "ct" : "20240229T163926",
            "lt" : "20240229T163926",
            "lbl" : [ "12Z", "12ZDelhi", "12ZDelhi42" ],
            "rn" : "STN_GW_CONNECT_CNT",
            "acpi" : [ "R248241" ],
            "et" : "20290227T142647",
            "st" : 0,
            "cr" : "SWGwg21074",
            "mni" : 20,
            "mbs" : 1048576,
            "mia" : 864000,
            "cni" : 0,
            "cbs" : 0
        }
    },
    "rvi" : "3"
}
Field Description op Operation Code (1 for create request). to Destination Resource ID (Target CSE resource ID). fr Sender (Station Gateway AE ID). rqi Unique Request Identifier to track the request. ty Resource Type (2 for <AE>). pc Primitive Content of the request. rvi oneM2M Release Version Indicator. rsc Response status code (2001: Created). 
## Subscription by Cloud to CCSP (created by station gateway)
Request SampleRequest & Response Sample With DataField Descriptions

Broker URL: mqtts://ccsp.m2m.cdot.in
Topic: /oneM2M/reg_req/<connect-container-ResourceId>/json

{
    "op" : 1,
    "to" : "<connect-container-ResourceId>",
    "fr" : "<STATION-GW-AE-ID>",
    "rqi" : "<unique-Request-Identifier>",
    "ty" : 23,
    "pc" : {
        "m2m:sub" : {
            "lbl": [ "<zone_code>", "<zone_code><division_code>", "<zone_code><division_code><sc>" ],
            "rn": "STN_GW_CONNECT_SUB",
            "acpi" : [ "<ACP-Resource-Id>" ]
        }
    },
    "rvi": "3"
}

}

            "ty" : 23,

## Subscription by Cloud to CCSP (created by station gateway)
Request SampleRequest & Response Sample With DataField Descriptions 
Request Details:
Broker URL: mqtts://ccsp.m2m.cdot.in
Topic: /oneM2M/reg_req/<parameter-container-ResourceId>/json

{
    "op" : 1,
    "to" : "<parameter-container-ResourceId>",
    "fr" : "<STATION-GW-AE-ID>",
    "rqi" : "<unique-Request-Identifier>",
    "ty" : 23,
    "pc" : {

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
• The Station Gateway Hierarchy defines how station gateways interact with the CCSP (C-DoT's Common Service Platform) and the railway management system.

  • Each station gateway maintains structured containers that store and manage different types of data, such as connection status, diagnostic reports, sensor values, and configuration updates.

  • The RDPMS Message Communication Flow illustrates how messages are exchanged between the station gateway, CCSP, and cloud applications, ensuring real-time monitoring and control.

docs.title: Types of Containers in Standard Data Format
docs.text: Container Types

docs.title: Station Gateway Connect Container:
docs.text: Created by the station gateway on the CCSP Layer, subscribed by the cloud app. It notifies the application software when a station gateway connects, reboots, or recovers from a power failure.

docs.title: Station Gateway Information Container:
docs.text: Created by the station gateway on the CCSP Layer, subscribed by the cloud app. It sends installation details and updates when sensors/IoT devices are added or removed. This occurs at least once a month and should be configurable.

docs.title: Image Container:
docs.text: Created by the station gateway, subscribed by the cloud app. It provides a snapshot of all parameter values at a defined interval (default: 24 hours, configurable).

docs.title: Parameter Container:
docs.text: Created by the station gateway, subscribed by the cloud app. It sends data when: a parameter changes by ±2% in the last 5 seconds or specific parameters (e.g., voltage/current of certain equipment) are sampled every 20 ms over 5 seconds or a packet is sent every 5 seconds with these values.

docs.title: Diagnostic Container:
docs.text: Created by the station gateway, subscribed by the cloud app. It reports the health status of all sensors/IoT devices when a fault occurs or at a configurable interval (default: 12 hours).

docs.title: Time Sync Container:
docs.text: Created and subscribed by the station gateway. The application software writes to it, sending a time synchronization request to the station gateway at first connection or at a configurable interval (default: 24 hours).

docs.title: Time Sync Acknowledgment Container:
docs.text: Created by the station gateway, subscribed by the cloud app. It sends an acknowledgment after the time sync process is completed.

docs.title: Configuration Container:
docs.text: Created and subscribed by the station gateway. The application software writes configuration updates, which are then received by the station gateway.

docs.title: Configuration Acknowledgment Container:
docs.text: Created by the station gateway, subscribed by the cloud app. It sends an acknowledgment once a configuration update is processed.

docs.title: Station Gateway Status Container:
docs.text: Created by the CCSP Layer. The station gateway sends an initial content instance to inform CCSP that all containers have been created, allowing access control policies to be activated.

docs.title: RDPMS Message Communication Flow
docs.text: Message Flow Diagram

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• The station Gateway shall create its resource hierarchy with ACP-ID shared in its configuration file. This will provide the station gateway with the privileges -CRUDN for <AE>, <container>, and <subscription> resources only in its station gateway <AE> resource.
  • Once resource hierarchy is created by Station Gateway AE, it shall create resource in status container of RAILWAY_MGMT_AE resource to indicate that it has created its hierarchy.
  • RAILWAY_MGMT_AE will be notified and it will set the privileges such that station gateway AE will be able to send data now.
